# Coral Harbor Remediation

## Overview

The Government of Canada invites registered Inuit firms to participate in a Remediation project in Coral Harbour, Nunavut. The project aims to remediate a former military base located approximately 10 km northwest of the Hamlet of Coral Harbour, Nunavut.

## Scope of Work

The Remediation project will include but is not limited to:

* Provision of equipment and materials
* Mobilization, demobilization, and logistics
* Provision of a camp and construction facilities
* Debris collection and segregation
* Remediation of buried debris
* Demolition of structures and fuel storage tanks
* Removal of fuel storage tanks from service
* Hazardous material/debris management and disposal
* Non-hazardous landfill construction, operation, and closure
* Contaminated soil excavation and disposal or treatment

## Important Notes

* The site visit has been moved to October 5, 2022. The maximum capacity has been reached, and additional bidder registration will not be accepted.
* Bidders must communicate with the Contracting Authority by 2:00 PM CDT on September 28, 2022, to confirm attendance and provide the names of the person(s) who will attend.
* Bidders are responsible for knowing and following provincial and territorial public health orders.
* It is mandatory that all persons attending the site visit have the proper safety equipment, including safety boots, hard hats, high-visibility vests, safety glasses, and proper outerwear to protect from the elements.
* All travel and living costs associated with travel to the site for the purpose of attending the Site Visit will be borne by the Contractor or their representative.

## Mandatory Participation

* A bidder's conference will be held following the release of the RFP. Details will be provided with the RFP posting.
* The bidders' conference is mandatory. Bidders may send more than one representative to attend the bidders' conference.
* Bidders who do not attend will be precluded from submitting a bid.

## Inuit Preference

This procurement is subject to the Directive on Government Contracts, Including Real Property Leases, in the Nunavut Settlement Area (the Nunavut Directive).
* The Nunavut Directive aims to increase participation by Inuit firms in business opportunities in the Nunavut Settlement Area economy.
* Bidders are required to register on the Inuit Firm Registry to participate in this opportunity.

## Procurement Details

* Procurement Category: SRV
* Procurement Method: Competitive -
